delicate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: needing to be dealt with carefully or sensitively in order to avoid problems or failure
delicate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: There’s something I have to speak to you about – it’s a delicate matter.
delicate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The sun can easily damage a child’s delicate skin.
delicate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: someone who is delicate is hurt easily or easily becomes ill
delicate.translation[0].definitions[3].d: a part of the body that is delicate is attractive and graceful
delicate.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Her wrists and ankles were slim and delicate.
delicate.translation[0].definitions[4].d: made skilfully and with attention to the smallest details
delicate.translation[0].definitions[4].e: a plate with a delicate pattern of leaves
delicate.translation[0].definitions[5].d: a taste, smell, or colour that is delicate is pleasant and not strong
delicate.translation[0].definitions[5].e: The wine has a dry delicate flavour.
